entries.title: Stellantis-Mercedes JV's Pivot to Cheaper Batteries Looks Smart
entries.description: The battery-making JV owned by Stellantis, Mercedes-Benz, and TotalEnergies is refocusing its strategy—and its money—on building cheaper batteries in a move that makes sense given underwhelming EV demand, Citi said.

entries.title: Israel Strikes U.N. School and Shelter in Gaza, Says Hamas Was Operating There
entries.description: Palestinian officials said dozens of displaced people were killed at the facility in central Gaza.

entries.title: U.K. Businesses See Wage Rises Slowing, BOE Survey Finds
entries.description: U.K. businesses expect wages to rise at a slower pace over the coming 12 months, a finding that will help reassure policymakers at the Bank of England that inflation has been tamed.

entries.title: Remy Martin Sees Tough Year Ahead as U.S. Slowdown Drags on
entries.description: Remy Cointreau expects efforts to clear out excess inventory in the U.S. to stretch into its new fiscal year amid a market slowdown, as the company seeks to pave the way for a return to sales growth.

entries.title: Oil Rebounds From Four-Month Lows Despite Demand Concerns
entries.description: Oil prices rebounded from four-month lows as market watchers viewed the recent sell-off as overdone, despite an unexpected build in U.S. crude and gasoline inventories.

entries.title: Antofagasta Secures Water Supply for Key Mine
entries.description: Antofagasta shares opened higher on London’s FTSE 100, on news the copper miner had signed a water-supply pact at its flagship Centinela site in Chile.

entries.title: Sterling Traders Await BOE Survey
entries.description: Sterling traded steady as markets awaited the Bank of England’s decision maker panel’s survey at 0830 GMT with information on inflation expectations, Brown Brothers Harriman said.

entries.title: Gold Futures Rise, Reclaiming Losses From Selloff in Late May
entries.description: Gold futures rose, further reclaiming ground lost in late May, and MUFG reiterated gold is its favorite buy this year on a trifecta of eventual Fed cuts, supportive central bank demand and its role as a geopolitical safe haven.

entries.title: Two-Year German Schatz Yield Expected to Fall by End of Third Quarter
entries.description: UniCredit Research has forecast the two-year German Schatz yield, currently trading close to 3%, to decline by 50 basis points by the end of the third quarter, helped by its expectation the ECB will cut rates this year by more than markets...

entries.title: German Manufacturing Orders Unexpectedly Decline
entries.description: Orders at German factories were 0.2% lower in April, compared with a 0.6% rise expected by economists, reflecting the persistent difficulties in the country’s industrial sector.

entries.title: China Vanke to Make Offshore Bond Payment, Easing Concerns
entries.description: The Chinese developer said it will pay a dollar bond due Friday, its final offshore debt obligation for the year, seeking to calm liquidity concerns amid China’s continuing property crisis.

entries.title: Stellantis Says Half a Million Cars Included in Recall Over Airbag Risk
entries.description: Stellantis said its current recall campaign affected 530,000 Citroen DS and C3 models produced between 2009 and 2019 that had Takata airbags.

entries.title: Atos Delays Rescue Package Deadline, Seeks Improved Terms
entries.description: Atos said the move comes as the conciliator of the company’s financial restructuring process has also requested for more time to determine which of the two proposals the company’s creditors prefer.

entries.title: TSMC Shares Hit Record High as AI Demand Boosts Chip Industry
entries.description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.’s shares hit a new record high amid positive news across the chip industry as global demand for advanced AI chips surges.

entries.title: The Unraveling of Rent the Runway, Explained
entries.description: Rent the Runway sought to disrupt the fashion industry in the early 2000s. But now the company is hemorrhaging money and subscribers. WSJ’s Sabela Ojea explains why.

entries.title: The Unraveling of Rent The Runway, Explained
entries.description: Rent The Runway sought to disrupt the fashion industry in the early 2000s. But now the company is hemorrhaging money and subscribers. WSJ’s Sabela Ojea explains why.

entries.title: Israeli Nationalists, Marching in Jerusalem, Balk at U.S. Cease-Fire Push
entries.description: Members of the religious right at Israel’s annual flag march called for resettling Gaza and the complete defeat of Hamas.

entries.title: Europe's Ascendant Right-Wing Parties Want to Remake the EU. They Can't Agree on How.
entries.description: Nationalist parties foresee strong results in EU elections this week but divisions over Ukraine, migration and history could blunt their impact.

entries.title: Putin said any deal to free Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich would come only through a mutually beneficial agreement with the U.S.
entries.description: Putin said any deal to free Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich would come only through a mutually beneficial agreement with the U.S.

entries.title: Hunter Biden's ex-wife and an ex-girlfriend took the stand in his trial as prosecutors tried to persuade jurors that he lied about his drug use during a 2018 firearm purchase.
entries.description: Hunter Biden’s ex-wife and an ex-girlfriend took the stand in his trial as prosecutors tried to persuade jurors that he lied about his drug use during a 2018 firearm purchase.
